It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other familiar plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Capsella pergrossa is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
